etymology.description: 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") + 盧(盧) (lú, "black", phonetic) = container for heating -> oven
etymology.interpretation: 爐(爐) (lú, "oven") combines the semantic component 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") indicating something related to heat, with the phonetic element 盧(盧) (lú, "black"), suggesting the sound. This forms a character for an object related to fire for cooking or heating.
etymology.simplification: The original component 盧(盧) (lú, "black") in 爐(爐) was kept phonetic in its simplified form 炉(炉), with the character reduced to straightforward strokes.

examples.chinese: 妈妈用爐烤蛋糕(媽媽用爐烤蛋糕)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā yòng lú kǎo dàn gāo.
examples.english: Mother bakes a cake using the oven.

examples.chinese: 我把比萨放进爐(我把比薩放進爐)，然后设定温度(然後設定溫度)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bǎ bǐsà fàng jìn lú, ránhòu shè dìng wēn dù.
examples.english: I put the pizza into the oven, then set the temperature.
